Report Abuse Never seen so many strange comments, that are totally unrelated to the story in my life! Bottom line? Vladimir Lenin is dead! It is barbaric to keep him on display like a museum relic. Should George Washington have been preserved and kept on display? No, because you respect the man's accomplishments and ideals, not his body. If the Russians truly respected the man, they would finally put his body to rest in a proper( non-viewing) tomb, instead of on display, like a tourist attraction. the Daily Star Sunday, the music mogul called Katie Price his "woman of the decade" and refused to rule her out of the running for a place on next series's show. who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. " Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. "We have been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time,

focus on external partnerships and business deals starting on April 4, when Page will take over the day-to-day management role. Page was Google's first CEO, and Eric Schmidt said in a blog post that Page in my clear opinion, is ready to lead. Sergey Brin will continue to focus on technology products, assuming the title of co-founder as opposed to his current role of president, technology.
